intro: Ferulago angulata subsp. carduchorum, commonly known as the Armenian fumitory, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and Central Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, with a hairy surface that helps reduce water loss. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
